title: by Section 47 of the Solicitors Act 1954 (as substituted by Section 54 of the
heading: 1. Citation and commencement
text_raw:
1. Citation and commencement 

(a) These Regulations may be cited as the Solicitors Practising 

Certificate (Application Fee) Regulations 2023. 

(b) These Regulations shall apply in respect of the 2024 practice 

year.
text_norm: 1 citation commencement (a) regulation may cited solicitor practising certificate (application fee) regulation 2023 (b) regulation shall apply respect 2024 practice year

title: by Section 47 of the Solicitors Act 1954 (as substituted by Section 54 of the
heading: 2. Definitions
text_raw:
2. Definitions 

(a) 

In these Regulations, except where the context otherwise 
requires: 

“Act of 1960” means the Solicitors (Amendment) Act 1960 (No. 37 of 1960); 

“Act of 2015” means the Legal Services Regulation Act 2015 (No. 65 of 
2015); 

“application fee” means the total amount of the fees payable in respect of any 
application for a practising certificate, as prescribed by the Society from time 
to time and includes, where appropriate and applicable, the registration fee, the 
contribution to the Compensation Fund pursuant to Section 22 of the Act of 
1960, the contribution in respect of the Authority's Levy Fund under the Act of 
2015 and shall, where applicable, mean the fees payable under these 
Regulations. 

“practice year” means the calendar year; 

“practising certificate” has the meaning given to it in Section 46 of the Act of 
1954; 

“the 2020 Regulations” means 
Regulations 2020; and 

the Solicitors Practising Certificate 

“the 2024 practice year” means the practice year commencing on 1 January 
2024 and ending on 31 December 2024. 

(b) Other words and phrases in these Regulations shall have the 
meanings assigned to them by the Solicitors Acts 1954-2015, 
the Act of 2015 and the 2020 Regulations. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 1st December, 2023. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [586] 3 

(c) The Interpretation Act 2005 applies to the interpretation of these 
Regulations as it applies to the interpretation of an Act of the 
Oireachtas.

title: by Section 47 of the Solicitors Act 1954 (as substituted by Section 54 of the
heading: 3. Application Fee
text_raw:
3. Application Fee 

The application fee specified in the Schedule hereto shall be payable in respect 
of applications for practising certificates for the 2024 practice year. 

Signed on behalf of the Law Society of Ireland pursuant to Section 79 of the 
Solicitors Act 1954. 

29 November, 2023. 

BARRY MACCARTHY, 

President of the Law Society of Ireland. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [586]
text_norm: 3 application fee application fee specified schedule hereto shall payable respect application practising certificate 2024 practice year signed behalf law society ireland pursuant section 79 solicitor act 1954 29 november 2023 barry maccarthy president law society ireland 4 586

title: by Section 47 of the Solicitors Act 1954 (as substituted by Section 54 of the
heading: within referred to
text_raw:
SCHEDULE 

within referred to 

(a) Registration Fee for the 2024 practice year payable to 
the Society on application for a practising certificate by 
an applicant solicitor who has been admitted to the Roll 
for three years or more on 1 January 2024: 

(b) Registration Fee for the 2024 practice year payable to 
the Society on application for a practising certificate by 
an applicant solicitor who has been admitted to the Roll 
for less than three years on 1 January 2024: 

(c) Contribution to the Compensation Fund for the 2024 
practice year payable to the Society on application for a 
practising certificate by an applicant solicitor: 

(d) Contribution 

to 

the Legal Services Regulatory 
Authority Levy Fund for the 2024 practice year payable 
to the Society on application for a practising certificate 
by an applicant solicitor: 

(e) Fee payable to the Society on each application, pursuant 
to Section 17 of the Solicitors (Amendment) Act 1960, 
for a copy of an entry on File A, File B or File C: 

(f) Fee payable to the Society on each application, pursuant 
to Regulation 11 of the 2020 Regulations, for the issue 
of a duplicate original practising certificate for the 2024 
practice year. 

EURO 

1,460 

1,190 

700 

430 

100 

50
